Pengusaha Masih Bisa Impor 480.000 Ton Garam hingga Akhir Tahun
05 Nov 2019, 10:00 by Vadhia Lidyana


Ilustrasi garam Impor (Foto: Mei Amelia/detikcom)

Jakarta - Pemerintah telah memberikan kuota impor garam industri sebesar 2,7 juta ton hingga akhir tahun 2019. Direktur Jenderal Perdagangan Luar Negeri Kementerian Perdagangan (Kemendag) Indrasari Wisnu Wardhana mengungkapkan, per Oktober 2019 realisasi impor garam industri tembus sebanyak 2,216 juta ton."Alokasi impor garam per Oktober 2,216 juta ton," ungkap Wisnu usai menghadiri rapat koordinasi di Kantor Kemenko Perekonomian, Jakarta, Selasa (5/11/2019).Sehingga, masih ada sisa kuota impor garam industri hingga akhir tahun sebanyak 484.000 ton. Menurut Wisnu, pelaku industri bebas merealisasikan sisa kuota impor garam tersebut."Tergantung industrinya, mau direalisasi atau tidak," ujar Wisnu.Ia mengatakan, pemerintah memperbolehkan realisasi sisa kuota impor garam industri tersebut sesuai dengan keputusan rapat koordinasi terbatas (rakortas) antar kementerian/lembaga terkait."Ya nggak apa-apa (kalau mau impor semuanya), kan memang sudah ditetapkan 2,7 juta ton," imbuh dia. Entrepreneurs Can Still Import 480,000 Tons of Salt until the End of the Year
05 Nov 2019, 10:00 by Vadhia Lidyana


Imported salt illustration (Photo: Mei Amelia / detikcom)

Jakarta - The government has provided a quota of industrial salt imports of 2.7 million tons by the end of 2019. Director General of Foreign Trade at the Ministry of Trade (Ministry of Trade) Indrasari Wisnu Wardhana revealed, as of October 2019 realization of imported industrial salt imports reached 2.216 million tons. " salt imports as of October 2,216 million tons, "said Wisnu after attending a coordination meeting at the Office of the Coordinating Ministry for the Economy, Jakarta, Tuesday (11/05/2019). So, there is still a residual quota of industrial salt imports until the end of the year of 484,000 tons. According to Wisnu, industry players are free to realize the remaining salt import quota. "Depending on the industry, whether it is realized or not," Wisnu said. "Yes, it's OK (if you want to import everything), it's already 2.7 million tons already set," he added.
